title: So...what is the purpose of this Ultimate skin?
body:
Like seriously, weren't these supposted to showcase Riot's tech and be somewhat experimental?

MF can transform her suit into 4 chromas. I'm going to assume they'll have separate animations? But you've already pretty much done this to a greater extent with Lux. Where's the 'wow' factor here? Sona could change the in-game music, Lux had her chroma set and Ezreal had unique evolving visuals. Udyr had 4 visually appealing stances on the fly and MF has...4 chromas.

Did you just want to give her a new skin?

This skin has simply no meaning as far as i can tell.

EDIT: Yes, i know it will be priced lower but 5 bucks off is not justifiable. It's essentially a Legendary skin with chroma sets that have minor variations in animations. Hell, Illaoi's actual chromas change her abilities' colours. This skin should be 2400 RP at best for it's lack of originality and i haven't even mentioned the massive clarity issues in-game. Blitzcrank lost his walking animation and i forgot i was watching a MF Special Interactions video mid-way through wondering to myself what this champion's abilities are like.

I don't think the point of Ultimate skins is to one-up the next one each time.

I think the point of Ultimate skins is to give champions a better-than-normal skin that people will have fun playing as, and that people wouldn't mind paying the RP for. 

Yes, Lux has 10 chromas in her Ultimate skin, but she can only choose two (well, three including light) each game. Udyr's stances are dependent on his skills. GGMF's 4 chromas give you more choice, since to our knowledge you can switch freely between each one in base. And since the skin looks freaking AWESOME, I'd say Riot did a great job with this Ultimate skin. 

Plus, if you are an ADC main, you've probably been waiting 5-6 years for an new Ultimate skin that you can use often. Not everyone plays Sona, Lux, or Udyr. (Although top mains are still waiting lol)

Finally, none of us have actually seen true in-game footage yet, so we should go into this with open minds. Don't always judge a skin by its cover.

As I said on another topic the common point between all the ultimate is the fact that the skin enhanced a fondamental aspect of the character:
Ezreal's job (Explorer), Udyr and whatever his connection with animal is, Sona's music talent, Lux's magical abilities, Miss Fortune's job (bounty hunter) 

> Gun Goddess Miss Fortune is a one-woman weapon of mass destruction and a legendary bounty hunter seeking revenge among a galaxy of thieves.

While this certainly seems to be the case, this doesn't really illustrate the "purpose" of this skin. There are a plethora of champions who's identity can be enhanced through an ultimate or non-ultimate skin.

I always saw Ultimate skins as a way for the art team to show us what they have learned, the innovations they made, a means to experiment with new cool ideas. Ultimate skins should push the boundaries on what is currently possible for skins, so that it may later be applied to other skins. We saw the model-evolution of Ezreal back in Kha'Zix. We saw Sona's unique music back in the star guardian skin line.

This Miss Fortune skin just uses the same concept as Elementalist Lux, but at what appears to be a lower quality. It feels incredibly lazy, and doesn't really add anything to the game like the previous Ultimate skins have.

Literally just a copy+paste from my Facebook comment on this:

"As someone who has, and has personally explored all it has to offer, it really is just a legendary skin with in-game Chromas. That's not giving it enough credit, though.

The particle effects for each of the different variations are indeed different in ways that match the Exo-suit used. The Exo-suit animations and ultimate animations are also different.

That's where the differences stop, though. The taunts, attacks, and ability cast animations are all identical. There's no different voice-effect for the different suits's AI so the actual difference between the suits are aesthetic--the only way I can really describe it. Different suit designs and different particle designs but that's it. It's cheap, tbh."

It's like they took a Legendary skin, redesigned it a few times, threw it all together and call it an Ultimate skin. There's no real WOW here. Spirit Guard Udyr pushed the idea of a full character upgrade--that's all it really was: same character, updated look. Pulsefire Ezreal explored the idea of a character changing throughout the game, which is something that Elementalist Lux expands upon by giving her overall character and particles changes with each evolution. DJ Sona both expanded on the character and gave you a nice gimmick in changing the in-game BGM that's shared with your teammates. Gun Goddess Miss Fortune is just copied idea.

That said, here's a suggestion. The skin itself isn't bad, it's just cheaply executed. Each Exo-suit should carry it's own story in their gameplay; give you a reason beyond aesthetics to change the suit. There should be different taunts, different dialogue, different voice-overs, different animations for each suit. And it slips my mind so I may be wrong, but isn't the ring for her E ability the same for all skins? The suits need more variety than design and ammunition, and I think those suggestions would get people hyped for it and draw less criticism as an overpriced chroma-set. The skin is called Gun **GODDESS** for crying out loud. There's nothing very **DIVINE** about it, in any use of the term.
